revised_title: Extinctions and Their Implications in Lower Palaeozoic Evolution
tldr: The article compares and contrasts the extinction events at the Cambrian-Ordovician and Ordovician-Silurian boundaries, discussing the factors that might have caused them. It highlights the importance of understanding the nature of paraphyletic groups and their role in the extinction events. The author also examines the problems associated with stratigraphy, correlation, and provincialism in the early Palaeozoic era.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
